boardgame.name: Yedo
boardgame.description: Japan, 1605 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; Hidetada Tokugawa has succeeded his father as the new Shogun, ruling from the great city of Edo (a.k.a. Yedo), the city known in present times as Tokyo. This marks the beginning of the golden age of the Tokugawa Shogunate and the so-called Edo Period that will last until 1868. Naturally, the most powerful families in Edo immediately try to curry favor with the new Shogun _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; and this is the opportunity our clan has been looking for, our chance at power and glory. Our clan will prove ourselves to be indispensable to the new Shogun. We will work from the shadows to acquire information about our rival clans. We will kidnap those who might oppose our ascent and assassinate those who prove a threat. We will use cunning to prevent our adversaries from doing the same to us. We will find glory and honor in the eyes of this new Shogun _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; or failing that we will end his rule by any means necessary._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the strategy game Yedo, players assume the roles of Clan Elders in the city of Edo during the early years of the Tokugawa Shogunate. The object of the game is to amass Prestige Points, mainly by completing missions. To do so, players must gather the necessary assets and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; most importantly _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; outfox their opponents and prevent them from completing their missions._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;There are several ways to reach your goal. Will you try to complete as many missions as possible and hope that your efforts catch the Shogun's eye? Or will you choose a more subtle way of gaining power by trying to influence the Shogun during a private audience? You can also put your rivals to shame by buying lots of luxury goods from the European merchants. It's all up to you _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; but be careful to make the right choices, for in Yedo, eternal glory and painful disgrace are two sides of the same coin..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

In Yedo players are all seeking to fulfil clandestine (or even criminal) missions around the Japanese capital under the Shogunate as they curry favour with the new Shogun. The artwork helps create the right atmosphere for what is a cracking game with just enough of a luck element This is the original English language edition of Yedo from Eggertspiele _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Pegasus (launched at Spiel _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;12). The quoted price is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). The tax-free price outside the EU is GBP 31.67. I charge shipping at cost and I can offer several options (or ask me to get a quote from couriers). To UK addresses: Second class (3 working days) £13.35 First class (1 working day) £15.10 MyHermes (3 working days) £6.60 Parcelforce express48 (2 working days, tracked) £12.92 To other EU countries: Air mail (1 week) £13.65 To North American addresses: Surface mail (up to 8 weeks, no tracking) £14.45 Air mail (1 week, no tracking) £23.40 Courier (3-5 working days, tracked) estimated at £30.00 NB: The purchaser is responsible for any taxes or duty due on import.

IDW Games (IDW00692) Japan, 1605 - Hidetada Tokugawa has succeeded his father as the new Shogun, ruling from the great city of Edo, (now Tokyo). All the most powerful families in Edo are trying to curry favor with the new Shogun, and you must ensure that your clan will prove indispensable to him. Work from the shadows to acquire information about rival clans, kidnap those who might oppose your ascent and assassinate those who prove too great a threat. Beware, only your cunning will prevent your adversaries from doing the same to you. Find glory and honor in the eyes of this new Shogun - or failing that, end his rule by any means necessary. Selected by Dice Tower host Tom Vasel as one of the Top 10 Worker Placement games, Yedo is an award-winning title from the designers of Kill Shakespeare: The Board Game!
German Pegasus version of the game. Box shows little wear. Inside everything there in great condition. Game has been played once.

In Yedo players are all seeking to fulfill clandestine (or even criminal) missions around the Japanese capital under the Shogunate as they curry favour with the new Shogun. The artwork helps create the right atmosphere for what is a cracking game with just enough of a luck element The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £25.00 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country. I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £7.05 (myHermes, takes 3 working days, tracked) For anywhere else, please ask for a quote from couriers as the game is over the 2 Kg limit for Air Mail.

Game is as new. FREE SHIPPING TO EUROPE AND NORTH AMERICA !!! Any boardgames order from this list starting from: $250 and above (EU zone) $360 and above (rest of Europe) $500 and above (USA and Canada) will ship FOR FREE, including sturdy package and tracking number !!! Any other destination country will also get very special shipping prices, almost free, ask for details !!
